item.title: Class8 Dumper! (php)
item.dc:creator: @tobias222 tobias222
item.description:
@tobias222 wrote:

I know there is a built in dumper method, I recommend using that,
but incase your client doesn’t have it,
feel free to upload your class8.java and try this out, it might work better :eek:

Okay don’t be too harsh, heres the script (unfinished)
It doesn’t work too bad actually.
please post fixed versions here xd (it doesn’t need that much fixing if you ask me)

[ul]Requirements:
[list][li]XAMPP, or any other php-enabled web server…[/li]
[/list]

Just upload this to a php webserver and upload your class8.java, then change the path :D[/ul]

<?
//Thanks for using this script i made, basically parses your class8.java file
$class8 = file("class8.java"); //path to class 8 file, must be hosted somewhere.


for($i=0;$i<count($class8);$i++){

if (strpos($class8[$i], 'if(i == ') !== false || strpos($class8[$i], 'class8.aString170 = "') !== false) {

//Replacing unnesscary crap, basically filtering...
$replace = array('if(i == ', 'class8.aString170 = "', ') {', '";', '){', 'aByte154 != 0)');
$with = array("", "= ", "", "<br>", "", "<br><br>Start:<hr>");
$output  = str_replace($replace, $with, $class8[$i]);

//Prints the final result to the page:
echo $output;

} else {

}

}
?>

Read full topic
